net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy

Class SSeMOEA

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.MOStrategy
      • net.sf.jclec.mo.strategy.SSeMOEA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.IConfigure, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstrainedSSeMOEA

    public class SSeMOEA
extends MOStrategy
    eMOEA strategy

    The Steady State epsilon Multi Objective Evolutionary Algorithm is a steady state algorithm that adapts the concept of Pareto dominance. It divides the objective space into hypercubes, so individuals are compared by means of the e-dominance relation, over the resulting partitioned landscape. Formally, the solution a e-dominates the solution b if a belongs to better or equal hypercubes and, at least, to a better hypercube than b. As detailed in the original paper, the length of each hypercube has to be configured by the user. This implementation also provides an optional automatic configuration of the lengths considering the desired number of hypercubes and the bounds of each objective function.

    Paper: K. Deb, M. Mohan, and S. Mishra, “Towards a Quick Computation of Well-Spread Pareto-Optimal Solutions”, in Evolutionary Multi-Criterion Optimization, vol. 2632 of LNCS, pp. 222–236, Springer, 2003.

    HISTORY:

    • (AR|JRR|SV, 1.0, March 2018) First release.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aurora Ramirez (AR), Jose Raul Romero (JRR), Sebastian Ventura (SV)

    Knowledge Discovery and Intelligent Systems (KDIS) Research Group: http://www.uco.es/grupos/kdis

    See Also:
    MOStrategy, Serialized Form

      • configure

        public void configure(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration settings)

        Parameters for SSeMOEA are:

        • epsilon-value (List):

          List of epsilon values to define the landscape partition (one for each objective function configure). If only one value is set, then it will be applied to all the objectives.

        • number-of-hypercubes (integer):

          Number of hypercubes. Default value is 10. This element is only used if the list of epsilon values is not provided.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface net.sf.jclec.IConfigure
        Overrides:
        configure in class MOStrategy

      • initialize

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> initialize(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population)
        Create the needed variables after the beginning of the algorithm. The initial archive will be created (if it is required) using the initial population.

        eMOEA requires the next initialization steps:

        1. Create the initial archive that will contain the non dominated solutions (e-dominance is checked) within the initial population.
        2. Compute the hypercubes of the individuals in the initial archive.

        Specified by:
        initialize in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals in the current population.
        Returns:
        The initial archive of solutions.

      • matingSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> matingSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                                java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select individuals that will act as parents.

        In eMOEA, this method performs the selection of two parents:

        • Parent 1: One solution is chosen from the current population. Two individuals are randomly selected and the dominance between them is checked. The non dominated individual is selected. If both are non dominated solutions, one of them is randomly selected.
        • Parent 2: One solution is randomly chosen from the archive.

        If the archive is empty, then the two parents are chosen from the current population.

        Specified by:
        matingSelection in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the external population.
        Returns:
        List of selected individuals (parents).

      • environmentalSelection

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> environmentalSelection(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> offspring,
                                                                       java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Select survivors for the next generation.

        In eMOEA, each offspring replaces a dominated individual in the current population. If the offspring does not dominate any individual, one individual randomly chosen is removed.

        Specified by:
        environmentalSelection in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        offspring - Individuals created by variation operators.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List of survivors.

      • updateArchive

        public java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> updateArchive(java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> population,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> offspring,
                                                              java.util.List<net.sf.jclec.IIndividual> archive)
        Update the archive of solutions.

        Before adding new solutions to the archive, the hypercubes of each individual within the current archive and the set of offspring are computed. Using these hypercubes, three situations can occur:

        • If the offspring is e-dominated by any individual within the archive, the offspring is not added.
        • If the offspring e-dominates some individuals within the archive, the dominated individuals are removed and the offspring is added.
        • If neither of the above two cases occur:
          • If the offspring belongs to the same hypercube than an archive member, Pareto dominance is checked. If the offspring dominates the other, it is added to the external set and the other is removed. If both are non dominated, the offspring is added if it has the closer euclidean distance to the ideal point in the hypercube, and the other is removed.
          • It the offspring belongs to a different hypercube set, it is accepted.

        Specified by:
        updateArchive in class MOStrategy
        Parameters:
        population - Individuals within the current population.
        offspring - Individuals created by variation operators.
        archive - Individuals belonging to the current archive.
        Returns:
        List containing the new member of the archive.
